title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
Analysts have been cutting their estimates for third-quarter earnings growth, signaling another possible test for the resilience of the stock market.

U.S. stocks rose ahead of the Tuesday release of consumer-price data for August, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow gaining 1.1%, 1.3% and 0.7%, respectively.

---

Peloton Interactive said co-founder John Foley and other senior leaders are leaving the company in a management shake-up.

---

Freight railroads said they plan to halt the transport of hazardous materials and sensitive cargoes as they continue negotiations with two labor unions.

---

Twitter's shareholders are poised to approve the $44 billion takeover that Musk is now trying to exit, according to people familiar with the matter.

---

Goldman is preparing to lay off hundreds of staffers as soon as next week, cuts that follow the reinstatement of annual performance reviews.

---

A rocket operated by Blue Origin failed during a planned uncrewed space flight, ending the mission prematurely, the Bezos-backed company said.

---

General Electric's Culp said the company's breakup plans are on track but that it continues to battle supply-chain pressures.

---

Oracle's sales topped expectations in the latest quarter, as its cloud businesses and the integration of Cerner lifted results.
